intro: Blepharis squarrosa, commonly known as the wooly blepharis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, succulent stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils or along streambanks. Its flowers are usually pale blue to purple and bloom during the summer months. The species is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy plant in dry climates.
